intro: Clematis chrysantha var. monantha, commonly known as the golden clematis, is a deciduous vine native to China. It features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and its stems are covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant flowers and graceful growth habit.
